duties_responsibilities.duty: Provides business analysis and active management for the core portfolio of services that the BTAA runs at scale on behalf of the member libraries.
Coordinates and administers licenses and contracts for services.
Designs discussion templates and communication plans for campus engagement on services run out of the core portfolio.
Coordinates and facilitates online and in-person programming and conversations around Big Collection services, including workshops, meetings, and online forums.
Manages programmatic multi-year budgeting for the services portfolio with the BTAA Operations team.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree. Three (3) years of experience working with services coordination, portfolio or program management, or equivalent. Advanced degree or equivalent years of experience. Experience working with services management in a community context, including large-scale complex systems. Experience with facilitation, group dynamics, and community organizing. Two years additional experience with leadership of collaborative projects, programs, and/or services. Experience with coordinating or administering contracts or licenses for services (such as technology licenses for cloud-based or SaaS services). Experience with collaborative software such as Microsoft Teams, Monday.com, Miro, and Google Docs. Related higher education work experience. Preferably familiarity with, or experience in large-scale research or academic libraries.
